Package a2

Class MyGame

java.lang.Object
tage.VariableFrameRateGame
a2.MyGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener
public class MyGame extends VariableFrameRateGame
MyGame extends VariableFrameRateGame and serves as the core game logic.

The game involves the player controlling a dolphin to navigate through an environment and disarm satellites while avoiding collisions. The player must disarm all satellites by getting close enough and pressing SPACE. Once all satellites are disarmed, the player wins the game. Features include:

  • Dynamic game objects (dolphin, satellites, interactive mini-cubes)
  • Multiple camera viewports, including: A main camera following the dolphin & a mini surveillance camera providing an alternative perspective (overhead POV)
  • Camera orbiting system for dynamic viewing angles
  • Collision detection and object interactions
  • HUD display for player status updates
  • Stretching and bouncing effects on disarmed satellites
  • Mini-cubes appearing on the dolphin to track disarmed satellites
Author:
Isabel Santoyo-Garcia

    • loadTextures

      public void loadTextures()
      Loads and assigns texture images to various objects in the game. Includes textures for the dolphin, sand, bee, sphere, torus, and their animated effects.
      Specified by:
      loadTextures in class VariableFrameRateGame

    • buildObjects

      public void buildObjects()
      Initializes game objects and sets up their initial transformations. This method creates the dolphin, satellites, ground plane, bee, mini cube, and axis position. Additionally, assigns the node controllers, StretchController and BouncingController.
      Specified by:
      buildObjects in class VariableFrameRateGame

    • initializeLights

      public void initializeGame()
      Initializes the game state, including input handling and camera positioning for multiple viewports. This method sets up controls for movement, turning, and riding the dolphin.
